original: Feminist biology examines the intersection of gender and biological research, challenging traditional assumptions about causation and the implications of biological differences. A key critique within this field is the reductive notion that causation flows solely from lower levels of biological organization to higher levels. Many feminist biologists aim to dispel stigmas and biases that have been historically accepted as scientific truth
sampled: Feminist biology examines the intersection upon gender and biological research, challenging traditional assumptions about causation and the implications with biological differences. A key critique within this field provides the reductive notion that causation flows solely from lower levels in biological organization to greater facets. Many feminist biologists aim to dispel stigmas and biases that have been historically accepted as scientific truth
